1.text: This is the book of the generations of Adam. In the day that God created man, He made him in His own likeness.

2.text: Male and female He created them, and He blessed them. And in the day they were created, He called them “man.”

3.text: When Adam was 130 years old, he had a son in his own likeness, after his own image; and he named him Seth.

4.text: And after he had become the father of Seth, Adam lived 800 years and had other sons and daughters.

5.text: So Adam lived a total of 930 years, and then he died.

6.text: When Seth was 105 years old, he became the father of Enosh.

7.text: And after he had become the father of Enosh, Seth lived 807 years and had other sons and daughters.

8.text: So Seth lived a total of 912 years, and then he died.

9.text: When Enosh was 90 years old, he became the father of Kenan.

10.text: And after he had become the father of Kenan, Enosh lived 815 years and had other sons and daughters.

11.text: So Enosh lived a total of 905 years, and then he died.

12.text: When Kenan was 70 years old, he became the father of Mahalalel.

13.text: And after he had become the father of Mahalalel, Kenan lived 840 years and had other sons and daughters.

14.text: So Kenan lived a total of 910 years, and then he died.

15.text: When Mahalalel was 65 years old, he became the father of Jared.

16.text: And after he had become the father of Jared, Mahalalel lived 830 years and had other sons and daughters.

17.text: So Mahalalel lived a total of 895 years, and then he died.

18.text: When Jared was 162 years old, he became the father of Enoch.

19.text: And after he had become the father of Enoch, Jared lived 800 years and had other sons and daughters.

20.text: So Jared lived a total of 962 years, and then he died.

21.text: When Enoch was 65 years old, he became the father of Methuselah.

22.text: And after he had become the father of Methuselah, Enoch walked with God 300 years and had other sons and daughters.

23.text: So Enoch lived a total of 365 years.

24.text: Enoch walked with God, and then he was no more, because God had taken him away.

25.text: When Methuselah was 187 years old, he became the father of Lamech.

26.text: And after he had become the father of Lamech, Methuselah lived 782 years and had other sons and daughters.

27.text: So Methuselah lived a total of 969 years, and then he died.

28.text: When Lamech was 182 years old, he had a son.

29.text: And he named him Noah, saying, “May this one comfort us in the labor and toil of our hands caused by the ground that the LORD has cursed.”

30.text: And after he had become the father of Noah, Lamech lived 595 years and had other sons and daughters.

31.text: So Lamech lived a total of 777 years, and then he died.

32.text: After Noah was 500 years old, he became the father of Shem, Ham, and Japheth.
